IL AMER 1.description: Lecture, five hours. Introduction to Zapotec language of Tlacolula Valley of Oaxaca. P/NP or letter grading.
IL AMER 1.title: Elementary Zapotec

IL AMER 119A.description: Lecture, five hours. Requisite: course 18C. Course 119A is requisite to 119B, which is requisite to 119C. Readings in Quechua. Dialectal and stylistic variation. Discussions mainly in Quechua. P/NP or letter grading.
IL AMER 119A.title: Advanced Quechua

IL AMER 119B.description: Lecture, five hours. Requisite: course 119A. Readings in Quechua. Dialectal and stylistic variation. Discussions mainly in Quechua. P/NP or letter grading.
IL AMER 119B.title: Advanced Quechua

IL AMER 119C.description: Lecture, five hours. Requisite: course 119B. Readings in Quechua. Dialectal and stylistic variation. Discussions mainly in Quechua. P/NP or letter grading.
IL AMER 119C.title: Advanced Quechua

IL AMER 17.description: Lecture, 15 hours; laboratory, five hours. Intensive course equivalent to courses 18A, 18B, 18C. Language of Incas and its present-day dialects, as spoken in Andean South America. Offered in summer only. Letter grading.
IL AMER 17.title: Intensive Elementary Quechua

IL AMER 189.description: Seminar, three hours. Limited to 20 students. Designed as adjunct to undergraduate lecture course. Exploration of topics in greater depth through supplemental readings, papers, or other activities and led by lecture course instructor. May be applied toward honors credit for eligible students. Honors content noted on transcript. P/NP or letter grading.
IL AMER 189.title: Advanced Honors Seminars

IL AMER 189HC.description: Tutorial, three hours. Limited to students in College Honors Program. Designed as adjunct to upper division lecture course. Individual study with lecture course instructor to explore topics in greater depth through supplemental readings, papers, or other activities. May be repeated for maximum of 4 units. Individual honors contract required. Honors content noted on transcript. Letter grading.
IL AMER 189HC.title: Honors Contracts

IL AMER 18A.description: Lecture, five hours. Course 18A is enforced requisite to 18B, which is enforced requisite to 18C. Language of Incas and present-day Quechua language, as spoken in Andean South America. P/NP or letter grading.
IL AMER 18A.title: Elementary Quechua

IL AMER 18B.description: Lecture, five hours. Enforced requisite: course 18A. Language of Incas and present-day Quechua language, as spoken in Andean South America. P/NP or letter grading.
IL AMER 18B.title: Elementary Quechua

IL AMER 18C.description: Lecture, five hours. Enforced requisite: course 18B. Language of Incas and present-day Quechua language, as spoken in Andean South America. P/NP or letter grading.
IL AMER 18C.title: Elementary Quechua

IL AMER 19.description: Seminar, one hour. Discussion of and critical thinking about topics of current intellectual importance, taught by faculty members in their areas of expertise and illuminating many paths of discovery at UCLA. P/NP grading.
IL AMER 19.title: Fiat Lux Freshman Seminars

IL AMER 191.description: Seminar, three hours. Research seminars on selected topics on various indigenous languages. Reading, discussion, and development of culminating project. May be repeated for credit with topic change. P/NP or letter grading.
IL AMER 191.title: Variable Topics Research Seminars: Indigenous Languages

IL AMER 2.description: Lecture, five hours. Enforced requisite: course 1. Introduction to Zapotec language of Tlacolula Valley of Oaxaca. P/NP or letter grading.
IL AMER 2.title: Elementary Zapotec

IL AMER 3.description: Lecture, five hours. Enforced requisite: course 2. Introduction to Zapotec language of Tlacolula Valley of Oaxaca. P/NP or letter grading.
IL AMER 3.title: Elementary Zapotec

IL AMER 596.description: Tutorial, to be arranged. Requisites: courses 119A, 119B, 119C. Directed individual study or research in Quechua. Four units may be applied toward M.A. course requirements. May be repeated for credit. S/U grading.
IL AMER 596.title: Directed Studies in Quechua

IL AMER 89.description: Seminar, three hours. Limited to 20 students. Designed as adjunct to lower division lecture course. Exploration of topics in greater depth through supplemental readings, papers, or other activities and led by lecture course instructor. May be applied toward honors credit for eligible students. Honors content noted on transcript. P/NP or letter grading.
IL AMER 89.title: Honors Seminars

IL AMER 89HC.description: Tutorial, three hours. Limited to students in College Honors Program. Designed as adjunct to lower division lecture course. Individual study with lecture course instructor to explore topics in greater depth through supplemental readings, papers, or other activities. May be repeated for maximum of 4 units. Individual honors contract required. Honors content noted on transcript. Letter grading.
IL AMER 89HC.title: Honors Contracts

IL AMER 99.description: Tutorial (supervised research or other scholarly work), three hours per week per unit. Entry-level research for lower division students under guidance of faculty mentor. Students must be in good academic standing and enrolled in minimum of 12 units (excluding this course). Individual contract required; consult Undergraduate Research Center. May be repeated. P/NP grading.
IL AMER 99.title: Student Research Program

IL AMER M115A.description: (Same as Chicana and Chicano Studies M162A and International and Area Studies M115A.) Lecture, four hours. Requisites: courses M15A, M15B, M15C. Course M115A is requisite to M115B, which is requisite to M115C. Taught primarily in Nahuatl. Examination of Nahuatl (Aztec) language of central Mexico at intermediate level. Coverage of Nahuatl grammar, with equal emphasis on reading, writing, conversation, and comprehension. P/NP or letter grading.
IL AMER M115A.title: Advanced Nahuatl

IL AMER M115B.description: (Same as Chicana and Chicano Studies M162B and International and Area Studies M115B.) Lecture, four hours. Requisite: course M115A. Taught primarily in Nahuatl. Examination of Nahuatl (Aztec) language of central Mexico at intermediate level. Coverage of Nahuatl grammar, with equal emphasis on reading, writing, conversation, and comprehension. P/NP or letter grading.
IL AMER M115B.title: Advanced Nahuatl

IL AMER M115C.description: (Same as Chicana and Chicano Studies M162C and International and Area Studies M115C.) Lecture, four hours. Requisite: course M115B. Taught primarily in Nahuatl. Examination of Nahuatl (Aztec) language of central Mexico at intermediate level. Coverage of Nahuatl grammar, with equal emphasis on reading, writing, conversation, and comprehension. P/NP or letter grading.
IL AMER M115C.title: Advanced Nahuatl

IL AMER M15A.description: (Same as Chicana and Chicano Studies M15A and International and Area Studies M15A.) Lecture, four hours. Enforced requisites: courses M5A, M5B, M5C. Course M15A is enforced requisite to M15B, which is enforced requisite to M15C. Taught primarily in Nahuatl. Examination of Nahuatl (Aztec) language of central Mexico at intermediate level. Coverage of Nahuatl grammar, with equal emphasis on reading, writing, conversation, and comprehension. P/NP or letter grading.
IL AMER M15A.title: Intermediate Nahuatl

IL AMER M15B.description: (Same as Chicana and Chicano Studies M15B and International and Area Studies M15B.) Lecture, four hours. Enforced requisite: course M15A. Taught primarily in Nahuatl. Examination of Nahuatl (Aztec) language of central Mexico at intermediate level. Coverage of Nahuatl grammar, with equal emphasis on reading, writing, conversation, and comprehension. P/NP or letter grading.
IL AMER M15B.title: Intermediate Nahuatl

IL AMER M15C.description: (Same as Chicana and Chicano Studies M15C and International and Area Studies M15C.) Lecture, four hours. Enforced requisite: course M15B. Taught primarily in Nahuatl. Examination of Nahuatl (Aztec) language of central Mexico at intermediate level. Coverage of Nahuatl grammar, with equal emphasis on reading, writing, conversation, and comprehension. P/NP or letter grading.
IL AMER M15C.title: Intermediate Nahuatl

IL AMER M5A.description: (Same as Chicana and Chicano Studies M5A and International and Area Studies M5A.) Lecture, five hours. Course M5A is enforced requisite to M5B, which is enforced requisite to M5C. Introduction to Aztec language of central Mexico. Coverage of basic Nahuatl grammar, with equal emphasis on reading, writing, conversation, and comprehension. P/NP or letter grading.
IL AMER M5A.title: Elementary Nahuatl

IL AMER M5B.description: (Same as Chicana and Chicano Studies M5B and International and Area Studies M5B.) Lecture, five hours. Enforced requisite: course M5A. Introduction to Aztec language of central Mexico. Coverage of basic Nahuatl grammar, with equal emphasis on reading, writing, conversation, and comprehension. P/NP or letter grading.
IL AMER M5B.title: Elementary Nahuatl

IL AMER M5C.description: (Same as Chicana and Chicano Studies M5C and International and Area Studies M5C.) Lecture, five hours. Enforced requisite: course M5B. Introduction to Aztec language of central Mexico. Coverage of basic Nahuatl grammar, with equal emphasis on reading, writing, conversation, and comprehension. P/NP or letter grading.
IL AMER M5C.title: Elementary Nahuatl
